subject: RE: [junit] EJB - JUnit Testing

messageBody:
Hi Sreenivasa,

Cactus (http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus) is the closest you'll probably get
to an EJB testing framework. The approach it takes is to run the tests from
it's own servlet, so you're running the test in the container. It makes for
a good integration test (make sure it's deployed correctly, etc.).
Deploying to run tests may slow things down a little.

Another option would be mock objects (http://www.mockobjects.com,
http://www.easymock.org). It has a lot of mock objects that will make your
EJB think it's in a container. I actually haven't tried them for EJBs, but
it would be the first place I would go.

If your EJB is simply a fa√ßade, then I'd concentrate more on testing the
supporting business classes/methods, which it sounds like you're already
doing.

Good luck,
-Larry

Hi,

Currently I am writing JUnit to test our business methods on EJBs. Is
there a framework exists exclusively for testing EJBs?

Thank you,
_Sreenivasa
